comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: The bones of three dogs were found in the chamber of Newgrange during excavations, one each from the east and west chambers and one from just outside the end chamber. It is not known for sure whether these bones are ancient or more modern. It is thought they may have belonged to stray dogs who got into the passage but could not get out again.

comment.author: 32162360@N00

comment.author: 20727502@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] Over-restored is definitely the term. While Knowth and Dowth are also massively restored, they never feel as Disney-fied as Newgrange. Similar to early photos of Stonehenge, this shot (and the others linked by beachcomberaustralia), demonstrate just how heavily rebuilt Newgrange has been. Pity really. Somehow I think the curators miss the value of the "just discovered" look - in favour of the "as it (might) have looked at the time". Sigh. Happy hols to Carol and her (cough) "Flickroonies". (We need to work on a more "butch" moniker in the new year :) )

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I would go with the OPW - wiki says "Entrance to Bru na Boinne, published in ''Celtic Myth and Legend'' by Charles Squire (1905), "  so it could be 1880 and shown in this book of 1905?

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: If I had a pound for every time I brought people to Newgrange I'd have 7/6d by now!  Seriously I love taking people out there and reckon I've been so often I could give the tour.  I can see what people say when they speak about the renovation but the mystery is inside and that is what blows my mind.  I just love the place almost as much as I love this place because the craic here is all year round and the characters are real and live. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77199267@N03] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/20727502@N00] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyair] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/vab2009] Happy Christmas to you all and a Happy and Prosperous New Year.
